title: LACE Index for Readmission
description: Predicts 30-day readmission or death in medical and surgical ward patients using four key clinical factors: length of stay, acuity of admission, comorbidities, and emergency department visits

parameters.name: length_of_stay_days
parameters.description: Length of current hospital stay in days

parameters.name: ed_visits_6_months
parameters.description: Number of emergency department visits in the 6 months prior to current admission

result.name: lace_score
result.description: LACE Index score predicting 30-day readmission or death risk

ranges.description: Low risk of 30-day readmission or death
ranges.interpretation: Patients with LACE scores 0-4 have low risk of 30-day readmission or death. Standard discharge planning and follow-up may be appropriate.

ranges.description: Moderate risk of 30-day readmission or death
ranges.interpretation: Patients with LACE scores 5-9 have moderate risk of 30-day readmission or death. Consider enhanced discharge planning and early post-discharge follow-up.

ranges.description: High risk of 30-day readmission or death
ranges.interpretation: Patients with LACE scores ≥10 have high risk of 30-day readmission or death. Intensive discharge planning, care coordination, and early follow-up strongly recommended.

references: van Walraven C, Dhalla IA, Bell C, et al. Derivation and validation of an index to predict early death or unplanned readmission after discharge from hospital to the community. CMAJ. 2010 Apr 6;182(6):551-7.

Walraven C, Wong J, Forster AJ. LACE+ index: extension of a validated index to predict early death or urgent readmission after hospital discharge using administrative data. Open Med. 2012;6(4):e80-90.

Gruneir A, Dhalla IA, van Walraven C, et al. Unplanned readmissions after hospital discharge among patients identified as being at high risk for readmission using a validated predictive algorithm. Open Med. 2011;5(2):e104-11.
Low LL, Tan SY, Ng MJ, et al. Applying the LACE index to an Asian population to predict 30-day hospital readmissions in an accountable care organization. Medicine (Baltimore). 2017 Jan;96(4):e5728.
formula: LACE = L + A + C + E, where L = Length of stay points (0-7), A = Acute admission points (0 or 3), C = Charlson comorbidity points (0-5), E = ED visits points (0-4)
notes: Applicable to both medical and surgical patients
Based on administrative data available at discharge
Higher scores indicate increased risk of 30-day readmission or death
Acute admission defined as unplanned admission through emergency department
Charlson Comorbidity Index should be calculated using ICD codes
ED visits counted for 6 months prior to current admission
Used for discharge planning and resource allocation
